education.degree: B.C.S Honours Computer Science, Minor in Biology
courses: Intro. to Computer Science I & II (Python & Java)

details: Optimized SVN-to-Git migration for core APIs, shrinking conversion time from weeks to hours and improving developer productivity.
Reduced repository size from 39 GB to 189 MB using a shell scripting and agentic AI to rewrite commit history, significantly improving performance and maintainability.
Debugged and tested the .NET API with .NET 9, identifying compatibility issues, raising Jira tickets, and updating XML documentation to improve developer clarity.
Built and deployed a full-stack trivia web application (React, Express.js, HTML/CSS, Vercel, Render) that supported 200+ users in 3 hours during a company scavenger hunt.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment through daily scrums, sprint planning, and Jira task tracking.
Provided timely support and coordinated appointments, demonstrating communication and teamwork.
Led 20+ campers in STEM activities and presented complex programming and engineering concepts.
Taught Python fundamentals, encouraged critical thinking, and problem-solving.
Collaborated with coordinators to create an inclusive and engaging learning environment.
Offered support by effectively addressing inquiries from current and prospective students through various communication channels.
Provided support in daily office operations, contributing to an organised and efficient workplace.
Utilized Microsoft Access and Excel for daily office operations
Participate in workshops and training sessions focused on leadership development, communication skills, and community engagement.

volunteering.organization: Science Student Success Centre, Carleton University
volunteering.role: Peer mentor, Computer Science Team Lead
details: Mentor undergraduate science students weekly, guiding academic, career, and social development.
Co-led and served as MC for the Computer Science Industry Mixer, engaging 140+ students and 16 industry professionals.
Deliver workshops and announcements to science classes with 100+ students.
Responsible for on-site and online execution of events and campaigns.
Helped organize the highly successful Female Founder Market, drawing over 500 attendees.
Organise and host weekly meetings, along with other executives, providing a fun and inclusive environment for students to engage in artistic activities.
Developed a strong passion for problem-solving and a commitment to creating meaningful and effective solutions.
Worked on my venture, from ideation and market research to project management.
Took part in a wide variety of social events from fundraiser booths to game booths.
Was responsible for the on-site and online execution of events and campaigns.
Provided professional greetings to all event attendees and efficiently assisted them with seat arrangements, ensuring a seamless experience.
Proactively addressed inquiries and provided information about the event, demonstrating strong communication and customer service skills.
Taught arithmetic Skills and English language Proficiency to students aged between 9 and 12 years in a classroom of approximately 15 students.
This role has helped me develop core skills in effective communication, leadership, creativity, time management and the ability to convey my thoughts effectively.
Helped students with their assignments and homework.
Computer Maintenance and organised the library
